content.description:
33

A battery of emf <math alttext="script E" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Îµ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is connected to three resistors, a switch, and a capacitor, as shown above. The resistance of resistor 1 is greater than that of resistor 2, which is greater than that of resistor 3.
content.question: The switch is closed and the circuit reaches a steady state. Which of the following correctly ranks the potential difference V across each of the components?

choices.label: <math alttext="V sub R 1 is greater than V sub R 2, which is greater than V sub R 3, which is greater than V sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="V sub R 1 is greater than V sub R 2, which is greater than V sub R 3, which equals V sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub R 1 is greater than V sub R 2, which equals V sub R 3, which equals V sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub R 1 is greater than V sub R 2, which equals V sub R 3, which is greater than V sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><msub><mrow><mo>></mo><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub R 1 is greater than V sub R 2, which equals V sub R 3, which equals V sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
